title: Harry Dunn's parents take legal action against Trump administration and Anne Sacoolas
text:
Harry Dunn’s parents have announced that they are taking legal action against both the American woman who killed their son and the US government, for letting her flee the UK.

Radd Seiger, the Dunn family spokesman, said they were seeking civil damages against Anne Sacoolas, who drove her car on the wrong side of the road on August 27, killing 19-year-old Harry. Mrs Sacoolas’s husband Jonathan was initially described as a diplomat, but is now believed to be a spy.

They are also bringing a federal case against Donald Trump’s administration for whisking her out of the country shortly after the accident, despite – contrary to initial belief – her not having diplomatic immunity.

The Foreign Office confirmed on October 13 that she did not have diplomatic immunity, and the Dunn family accuse the Trump administration of breaking the Vienna Convention, which dictates how diplomatic immunity works. On Thursday they sued the Foreign Office.

“The Trump administration have tried to twist and contort the laws on diplomatic immunity to argue that Mrs Sacoolas should be permitted to skip the UK after her actions and escape justice,” said Mr Seiger.
